Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that George Holding has specifically voted 13 times to deny coverage for pre-existing conditions. Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that all of George Holding's votes on bills related to pre-existing conditions were aimed at denying coverage. Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for George Holding's votes on bills related to pre-existing conditions. Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the Affordable Care Act (ACA) bans insurers from denying coverage based on pre-existing conditions. Understate: The claim may underestimate the potential impact of Holding's votes on bills related to pre-existing conditions. Falters at times: The claim falters by not providing a comprehensive analysis of all the bills voted on by George Holding related to pre-existing conditions.
